Text: Out of the depths I cry to You, O LORD!
Context: The psalmist expresses a deep sense of need and desperation, calling out to God from a place of despair.

Text: O Lord, hear my voice; let Your ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
Context: The plea for God's attention continues, with a specific request for God to listen to the psalmist's earnest prayers.

Text: If You, O LORD, kept a record of sins, Lord, who could stand?
Context: The psalmist reflects on the impossibility of standing before a holy God if He counted all sins against us, emphasizing God's righteous standard.

Text: But with You there is forgiveness, so that You may be feared.
Context: Despite the concern over sin, this verse shifts to a positive note as the psalmist acknowledges God's forgiveness, which instills a reverential fear and awe.

Text: I wait for the LORD; my soul waits, and in His word I put my hope.
Context: There is an expression of hope and patience as the psalmist waits expectantly for the Lord, trusting in His promises.

Text: My soul waits for the Lord more than watchmen for the morningâ€”more than watchmen for the morning.
Context: The anticipation for the Lord's intervention is likened to watchmen waiting for the break of dawn, emphasizing the certainty and eagerness of this expectation.

Text: O Israel, put your hope in the LORD, for with the LORD is loving devotion, and with Him is full redemption.
Context: The psalmist encourages others to hope in the Lord, highlighting God's steadfast love and the complete redemption He offers.

Text: He Himself will redeem Israel from all their iniquities.
Context: The final verse provides strong assurance that God will indeed redeem His people from all their sins, affirming His power and willingness to save.
